body.name: Toshiba X300 PRO 4TB High Workload Performance for Creative Professionals 3.5-Inch Internal Hard Drive – Up to 300 TB/Year Workload Rate CMR SATA 6 GB/s 7200 RPM 256 MB Cache - HDWR440XZSTB
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 16 hrs 27 mins
features: Designed for professional desktop workstations and high performance PC
High Performance with 7200 RPM and large cache size
High reliability with workload rate of up to 300 TB/year and MTTF up to 1.0 million hours.
Toshiba's cache technology to deliver high-level performance in real time
Ramp loading technology & built-in shock sensors to help protect your content.
body.description: Built for high-end workstations and multi-media systems, the X300 Pro can support high intensity workloads up to 300TB/yr with increased reliability of up to MTTF 1.0 million hours and room up to 18TB of storage capacity. Optimized to handle high-end graphics and videos, the X300 Pro hard drive delivers a fast 7200 RPM rotational speed and large cache size to help shorten response time. Toshiba’s cache technology helps optimize cache allocation during read/write cycles to help provide high drive performance in real time. Plus, the X300 Pro’s innovative actuator designs help optimize positioning accuracy and read/write performance for quick access to data. [Note]: (1) One Terabyte (1TB) means 10{12] = 1,000,000,000,000 bytes using powers of 10. Actual formatted storage capacity may vary. For details, please visit Toshiba's Consumer HDD website. (2) Compatibility may vary depending on user’s hardware configuration & operating system. (3) Product specifications, colors, configurations and components are subject to change without notice. (4) "2.5-inch" & "3.5-inch" mean the form factor of HDDs. They do not indicate drive's physical size. (5) For "Drive Bays Supported", please contact your Solutions Provider as compatibility with host device will vary based on the system. (6) Workload is a measure of the data throughput of the year, and it is defined as the amount of data written, read or verified by commands from the host system. (7) MTTF (Mean Time to Failure) is not a guarantee or estimate of product life; it is a statistical value related to mean failure rates for a large number of products which may not accurately reflect actual operation. Actual operating life of the product may be different from the MTTF. (8) Read and write speed may vary depending on the host device, read and write conditions, and file size. (9) Drive life may vary depending on usage and workload. (10) Standard limited warranty terms apply. The warranty brochure can be viewed at Toshiba's Consumer HDD website.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Key Features Upgrade Your Workstation Enhance your productivity with the X300 Pro that delivers a high workload rate of up to 300TB/year(6), allowing you to keep up with your content creation and storage demands. The X300 Pro offers up to 20 TB(1) of capacity to empower you to create more and to store your creations without worrying about running out of space. High Reliability The X300 Pro supports increased MTTF up to 1.0 million hours(7). The drive’s internal shock sensor and ramp-loading technology help protect your drive and data from harm. Enhanced Performance Optimized to handle high-end graphics and videos, the X300 Pro hard drive delivers a fast 7200 RPM rotational speed and up to 512MB cache size to help shorten response time. Toshiba’s cache technology helps optimize cache allocation during read/write cycles to help provide high drive performance in real time. Plus, the X300 Pro’s innovative actuator designs help optimize positioning accuracy and read/write performance for quick access to data.

Toshiba X300 Pro Performance Internal Hard Drive Take your creativity to the next level with the enhanced speed, reliability, and capacity of the Toshiba X300 Pro Performance Internal Hard Drive. Built for the creative professional, the X300 Pro hard drive is designed to support your large workload and storage needs, so you can create without limits.

Enhanced Performance 7200 RPM with up to 512MB cache size. Powered by Toshiba cache technology to help deliver real-time drive performance. State-of-the-art actuator enables high-precision head positioning with accurate data tracking. Data Protection Ramp loading technology & built-in shock sensors to help protect your content. Built to Last Supports high Workload Rate of up to 300 TB/yr(6). MTTF up to 1.0 million hours(7). Capacity for More Up to 20 TB(1) to store your large multimedia files and growing content libraries. CMR technology delivers consistent performance and broad compatibility. Enhanced Performance Data Protection Built to Last Capacity for More

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lots of storage space and good performance
reviews.reviewText: I added this Toshiba X300 Pro 20 TB to my desktop PC to store my media library. Installation was a breeze. Hooked up the cables, started up Windows, created and formatted a new volume with Disk Management - done. At the moment I have about 14 TB of misc audio and video files on it. I mostly just read from it, but I do have some ongoing projects on it as well. Read/Write speeds are quite good, I reckon the 7200 RPM and 512 MB cache help with that. I've only had the drive for a few weeks, so I can't attest to its reliability. If something should happen, I'll update this review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally a Reliable Hard Drive
reviews.reviewText: For physical platter-style hard drives, quality levels have gone down! But not for the Toshiba X300 Pro. Before I landed on this drive, I tried:• 20 TB Seagate Exos - dead on arrival• 10 TB Western Digital Black - would crash during format no matter what, even in differing OS's!• 6 TB Western Digital Ultrastar DC HC310 - awesome enterprise drive but came USED and was twice as loud as the Toshiba.I used this drive to store 12 TB of data from my RAID 5 video content before building a new RAID 5 and then transferred all the data once complete. So it's first use was dealing with 24 TB of data! And the read/write performance is surprising: I'm getting upwards of 280 MB/s, I'm very surprised... and happy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Out of official Toshiba warranty
reviews.reviewText: About Toshiba X300 16 TB Pro version. The drive is good. You can tall right away, that this is a premium quality product. The warranty is not provided by Toshiba itself, but by a third party. It's not a big deal!Makes tapping noises under load, but in idle it's absolutely quiet.It was delivered in a paper padded mailer, not in a cardboard box. Which is a strange decision. But the OEM box is well done. I'm pretty sure you can play football with it and it won't harm the drive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent HDD performance
reviews.reviewText: This drive works great and is fast for a regular hard drive. The 512 MB cache really helps it along. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Go Pro...or go home...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: As time goes on files get larger. I started computing life on a early model IBM with a blazing 10mb hard drive when most computers had 2 - 360KB drives. Yeah I'm old. Fast forward 35 years later and hard drives have surpassed 20 TB. This 18TB drive will house my personal and work files. I do alot of movie editing and it takes alot of space. The drive itself is fast enough. The only complaint is it is a little chatty. Not distracting per se but you notice it. For the price I paid it's perfect for my needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DEAD ON ARRIVAL
reviews.reviewText: If you made it this far you are lucky. Do not buy this drive, especially the 12TB one as the one I got did not work. First hard drive I have ever bought (and I have bought hundreds) that did not work out of the box. I mean a lot of people are saying this quits working after a few months or what not, but this one never worked to begin with, just made clicking noises from the very beginning. Not sure how it is even possible that it made it out of the factory. Another reason not to buy, there is no warranty on these because they were sold through a 3rd party, so I did not read the reviews prior to buying but others have mentioned it too, if you go to Toshiba's website and plug in the Serial Number it will tell you its out of warranty. Oh, and its even a hassle to return now, had to wait for days to get a label, and the return address is in Canada. Stay away from this seller, far far AWAY!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Exactly as expected
reviews.reviewText: Packaging is good. Arrived in good condition and worked right out the box. No issues after several weeks of use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast 8 TB hard drive.
reviews.reviewText: Installed easily into my new Gaming PC.High speed. No issues

Hard Drive is almost as fast as my WD Black. Works great so far. Beware that Amazon shipped this product in its OEM box with a shipping label on it. My box was damaged in shipping but fortunately the product works. My friends was shipped in a bubble wrap envelope so at least his was in better shape. Luck of the draw on Amazon's packaging practice.

Got it for 135 cad on around black friday. 33.75 dollars per tb of 7200 rpm storage .The pro version seemingly provides exactly the same stats except an explaination that its "built to last" coupled with I believe a 4 year warranty compared to the 2 year warranty of the original model.The thing is that toshiba makes some of the most reliable drives out there with an average 1 percent annual failure rate average across their drives according to the stats on the cloud storage provider backblaze and is only outclassed by hitachi with a 0.42 annual failure rate.So to have something created for reliability by a company that already makes reliable drives makes a very pleasant combination with enough speed to do anything you want. I'm looking forward to this drive serving me well for years and years.Lastly, even though this drive is "reliable" as in way more reliable than others no drive is reliable and you should always back up your data onto low rpm cheap storage.Tldr: Great value for great speed, and insane reliability. Recomended for active storage of programs and games with a small ssd for the operating system.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too much noise from HDD when its in use
reviews.reviewText: Model: Toshiba X300 PRO 6TBFirstly I thought the rain was going on outside hence I am receiving this noise!2ndly the weather was not good though there was no rain!3rd try, I did check all fans by turning them off!Then I realize I am downloading large files from the internet and saving them to this HDD directly!It's more like popcorn noise but a little lower side.If the noise doesn't matter, you can go ahead and buy it!
